summary: In a crisis, the government relies on oceangoing U.S.-flag ships and U.S.-citizen crews to help the military. To ensure their availability, the government provides stipends and requires certain government cargoes to be shipped on U.S.-flag ships. But we testified that: U.S.-flag ships have become more expensive to run and the government has shipped less cargo—making it harder for carriers to stay in business. There may...
title: Maritime Security: DOT Is Still Finalizing Strategy to Address Challenges to Sustaining U.S.-Flag Fleet
